node.title: 'We won't stop looking': Police warn those helping man wanted for homicide could face prosecution
node.description: Sam Junior Angelo Thomsen, 42, is wanted as part of a homicide investigation.
node.content: ["Police say anyone found to be helping a man wanted as part of a homicide investigation could face prosecution.\u00a0", "Sam Junior Angelo Thomsen, 42, is wanted by police as part of an investigation into Brian James' death.\u00a0", "James was shot and killed at an address on Glass Road in the Auckland suburb of Mt Roskill on December 23, 2021.", "Detective Inspector Scott Beard says friends and associates of Thomsen are believed to be helping him evade police.", "\"The team are working through some possible sightings of Thomsen reported by the public,\" says Detective Inspector Beard.", "\"It is not a matter of if, but a matter of when, police find Thomsen.", "Beard urged Thomsen to either give himself up now and for anyone who knows where he is to contact police.\u00a0", "\"Those found to be harbouring Thomsen could well find themselves being prosecuted. Our message to Thomsen is that we won't stop looking for him.", "\"The Warrant to Arrest gives us the power to enter any address police have reasonable cause to believe he is in.\"", "Beard said if seen, Thomsen should not be approached. Instead, call police on 111 or alternatively you can contact police anonymously through Crime Stoppers on 0800 555 111.\u00a0"]
